alert.note: Alert for Annette Island; Ketchikan Gateway Borough; Prince of Wales Island (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Watch issued November 20 at 1:03PM AKST until November 20 at 9:00PM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WATCH FOR LANDSLIDES IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM AKST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Landslides caused by excessive rainfall are possible. * WHERE...The following areas, Prince of Wales and Southern Inner Channels. This includes the cities of Craig, Klawock, Hydaburg, Coffman Cove, Thorne Bay, Ketchikan, And Metlakatla. * WHEN...Until 9 PM AKST this evening. * IMPACTS...Landslides have been reported and continue to be possible in areas of steep terrain. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - National Weather Service Meteorologists are forecasting heavy rainfall to continue over the area through mid evening, which may lead to additional landslides due to heavy precipitation and windy conditions in prone areas. - All residents on or near mountain slopes should be prepared for possible landslides. - Similar storms have been associated with an increased risk of landslides. If you live on a mountainside or at the base of a steep mountain be ready to leave in advance of the storm. Consider postponing travel along roads that have been impacted by landslides in the past during periods of heavy rainfall.
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information.
